title: Burn address cannot be set via Key Manager API
body:
### Description
Performing an HTTP(S) POST to the Key Manager API of the Teku validator service for setting the fee recipient to the burn address for a specific validator pubkey results in a 400 Bad Request error: `{"code":400,"message":"Cannot set fee recipient to 0x00 address."}`. What is the rationale for this? Is it possible to allow setting the burn address as fee recipient?

### Steps to Reproduce

curl -k --cert-type P12 --cert <cert_file>:"<cert_pass>"  -X POST "https:/<validator_container>:<validator_port>/eth/v1/validator/<pubkey>/feerecipient" -H  "accept: */*" -H  "Content-Type: application/json" -d "{\"ethaddress\":\"0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000000\"}" -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>"

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]
The fee recipient should be set even if it is the burn address

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]
The 0x00 address cannot be set as fee recipient for a validator

### Versions (Add all that apply)
`teku/v23.10.0/linux-x86_64/-eclipseadoptium-openjdk64bitservervm-java-17`

Running in Docker
